page.title: 05Farming (Continued)
page.content: some beef. Although the population of Dudleston Heath/Criftins has risen since the second world war, the farming community has more or less unchanged. The farming scene remains traditional e.g. few creation of large fields by uprooting hedges etc, but as been updated by machinery and modern farming methods. Small holdings around Criftins consist of scattered fields little bigger than padocks. Example of farms and small holdings :- Mr.B.Morris -Oakfields 29 acres, 250 sheep and 12 beef cattle. Mr.+Mrs.M. Jones -Penross 38 acres and 18 dairy cows Mr.+Mrs. Taylor -Gadlas Hall 3 acres,1 calf, 2 sheep, and 12 chickens. Mr. Jennings -The Orchards Nursery. Bedding plants, vegetables,pot plantst
